newsitem.title: USA: Payless Cashways to close nine stores.
newsitem.headline: Payless Cashways to close nine stores.

text.p: Payless Cashways Inc said Tuesday it plans to close nine underperforming stores, for which it took an after-tax store closing charge of $8.5 million in the August 24 third quarter.

The building materials specialty retailer also said its lenders agreed in principle to amend Payless Cashways' 1995 Credit Agreement to revise certain terms and to extend and increase available credit.
The amended agreement was designed to provide the company with flexibility and liquidity to continue implementing its strategic plan.

Chairman David Stanley, in a statement, said "(It) will put to rest questions about the company's ability to meet its obligations. It is a long-term agreement -- through November 2000. The covenants are based on a realistic operating profile."
Payless did not identify the locations of the stores it plans to close. It operates 200 stores in 22 states.
Payless Cashways also reported a third-quarter loss, including charges, of $0.61 per share compared to a year-ago profit of $0.17 per share.
Sales declined to $723.8 million from $737.2 million.
"In spite of intense new competition, comparable store sales results improved each month of the quarter," Stanley noted. "August's 2.5 percent increase was the highest since December 1994."
